emissions.closest_match_explanation: The ingredient '1 lille løg' is best matched with 'løg' because it is the most direct and least processed form of onion available in the database. This aligns with rule 4, which prioritizes the least processed option when no specific processing is mentioned.

The ingredient '2 fed hvidløg' is best matched with 'hvidløg' as it is the most direct and least processed form of garlic available. This follows rule 4, which favors the least processed option when no specific processing is indicated.

The ingredient '0.5 rød peberfrugt' is best matched with 'peberfrugt' because it is the most direct and least processed form of bell pepper available in the database. This aligns with rule 4, which prioritizes the least processed option when no specific processing is mentioned.

The ingredient 'olie' is a general term for oil. Among the available options, 'olivenolie' has the highest emission factor (5.9 kg CO2e / kg) and is a common type of oil. According to rule 5, when multiple viable options have similar processing levels (all are oils), the one with the highest emission factor should be chosen to ensure a conservative estimate.

The ingredient '250 g oksekød' is a general term for beef. Among the available options, 'oksekød, pulled beef' has the highest emission factor (56.3 kg CO2e / kg). According to rule 5, when multiple viable options have similar processing levels (all are beef products), the one with the highest emission factor should be chosen to ensure a conservative estimate.

The ingredient '1.5 spsk fajitakrydderi' is a seasoning blend. 'peber, chili' is the most relevant and highest emission option among the choices, as chili is a common component of fajita seasoning. This aligns with rule 5, which states that if multiple viable options exist, the one with the highest emission factor should be chosen.

The ingredient 'chilipulver eller flager' is best matched with 'peber, chili, konserves' because it represents a processed form of chili, similar to how chili powder or flakes are processed. This aligns with rule 4, which considers the amount of processing. Among the chili options, 'peber, chili, konserves' has a higher emission factor (1.5 kg CO2e / kg) than 'peber, chili' (1.1 kg CO2e / kg), aligning with rule 5 to choose the higher emission factor when processing levels are similar.

The ingredient '1 dåse kidneybønner' is best matched with 'kidney bønner, konserves' because it explicitly states 'dåse' (can), indicating a canned and thus processed form. This aligns with rule 4, which prioritizes matching based on the amount of processing.

The ingredient '2 spsk tomatpuré' is best matched with 'tomatpure, koncentreret' because 'puré' implies a concentrated form of tomato, which aligns with the processing level of 'koncentreret'. This follows rule 4, which considers the amount of processing.

The ingredient '2.5 dl oksefond/-bouillon' is best matched with 'bouillon, oksekød, koncentreret, terning' because 'fond/-bouillon' implies a concentrated form, and among the beef bouillon options, the concentrated cube has the highest emission factor. This aligns with rule 4 (processing) and rule 5 (highest emission factor for similar processing).

The ingredient '11 små majstortillas' is best matched with 'taco shells' because both are corn-based, crispy, and commonly used in Mexican cuisine. While 'tortillabrød, hvede' is also a tortilla, 'taco shells' are more specific to corn-based, crispy forms often associated with 'small' tortillas. Additionally, 'taco shells' has a higher emission factor (2.4 kg CO2e / kg) than 'tortillabrød, hvede' (1.2 kg CO2e / kg), aligning with rule 5.
